recipe.title: How to Make Rice Krispies Treats

procedure.summary: Melt 3 tablespoons (45 grams) of butter in a large saucepan.
procedure.description: Add the butter to the saucepan, then place the saucepan on a burner over low heat. Avoid using diet margarine in place of butter since it will give the treats a greasy, unpleasant taste.

procedure.summary: Add 1 package of marshmallows and cook them for 10-15 minutes.
procedure.description: Empty the entire package into the pan, and stir the butter and marshmallows together until the marshmallows are completely melted. This should take 10-15 minutes. You can use 4 cups (100 grams) of miniature marshmallows instead of 1 package of big marshmallows. Or, you can use a 7-ounce (200-gram) jar of marshmallow crème instead.Microwave Rice Krispies treats: To make the treats in the microwave, heat the butter and marshmallows on high for 2 minutes. Take the mixture out of the microwave and stir it with a spatula. Then, put it back in the microwave and heat it for 1 more minute.

procedure.summary: Stir in 6 cups (150 grams) of Rice Krispies cereal.
procedure.description: After you add the cereal, stir the mixture with a spatula until the Rice Krispies are completely coated in butter and marshmallows. This should take about 5 minutes.Variation: You can make Rice Krispies treats using any kind of cereal you like! Just swap out the Rice Krispies cereal with 6 cups (150 grams) of your favorite cereal, and stir it into the melted butter and marshmallows until it’s completely coated.

procedure.summary: Press the mixture into a greased pan and let it cool for 10-15 minutes.
procedure.description: Take a 13 by 9 by 2 in (33.0 by 22.9 by 5.1 cm) pan and cover it in a layer of cooking spray. Then, rub some butter onto your spatula and use it to scoop the mixture into the pan. Press the mixture into the pan until the surface is flat and level. Once the mixture is in the pan, let the treats cool at room temperature for 10-15 minutes. Putting butter on the spatula will help the mixture slide off of it without sticking.

procedure.summary: Cut the Rice Krispies treats into 2 in (5.1 cm) squares.
procedure.description: After the treats have cooled for 10-15 minutes, they’re ready to be served! Rice Krispies treats taste best if you serve them the same day you make them. You can use a butter knife to cut the Rice Krispies treats.

procedure.summary: Store the treats in an air-tight container at room temperature.
procedure.description: Your Rice Krispies treats should stay fresh for up to 2 days. If you want them to last longer, place them in an air-tight container, separating the layers of treats with wax paper, and freeze them for up to 6 weeks. If you freeze your Rice Krispies treats, let them sit at room temperature for 15 minutes before serving them so they have time to thaw.
